article.headline: Centenary 84, Nicholls State 71
article.story: SHREVEPORT, La. (AP) -- Alexander Starr and Tyrone Hamilton each scored 17 in Centenary's 84-71 come-from-behind win over Nicholls State on Saturday. Despite shooting just 34.3 percent in the first half, Centenary (4-4) stayed close by forcing 11 turnovers and winning the rebounding battle. Of the Gents' 19 rebounds, 10 came off the offensive glass. The Colonels (0-9) frustrated Centenary, shooting 65 percent from the field in the opening half. Centenary trailed by as many as 10 points after Nicholls' Stefan Blaszczynski drained his fourth 3-pointer of the period with 4:40 remaining. Trailing 37-27, Centenary finished the half on a 10-1 run backed by four points each from Hamilton and Nick Stallings, to go into the break down just one at 38-37. Nicholls cooled off in the second half and Centenary heated up, shooting 62.5 percent from the floor and hitting 12-of-13 free throw attempts down the stretch to pull away. Blaszczynski led all scorers with 24 points on 8-of-12 shooting, including 5-of-7 from 3-point range. Ryan Bathie added 17 and Aaron Scott had 10 for the Colonels. Lance Hill finished with 16 points for the Gents and Larry Logan had 14.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
